page.title: 03FOUR MARKS : NOW
page.content: Now: These days, water is taken through pipes to houses. Lighting is by electricity. Cooking is done on gas or electricity. People don't keep animals to eat any more but keep rabbits, cats and dogs for pleasure. At present, there is no mains sewage connection. Each house has its own septic tank. Things are much larger these days; Four Marks used to be a little village, now it's turning into a small town. Four Marks school is much larger. There are sixteen staff. Children don't stay at the school until 14 any more, because the oldest is 11. Transport is sometimes walking or cycling but usually by car, train, bus or aeroplane. Entertainment is nearly the same as it was then, except we have television and video records.
